We want to put the smallest digit in the greatest place value. 

Which digit is the smallest?

$\maroonD1$ is the smallest digit, and we want to put it in the position with the highest place value.   

  So $\maroonD1$ will be in the hundred thousands place: 
 $\maroonD{1}$ $\_$ $\_{,}$ $\_$ $\_$ $\_$

Now we need to do the same thing with the next smallest digit:  $\blueD3$.  

So  $\blueD3$ goes in the ten thousands place:  

$\maroonD{1}\blueD3 $\_${,}$ $\_$ $\_$ $\_$

We can continue placing the next smallest digit in the next largest place value until we have placed all six digits:

$\maroonD{1}\blueD36{,}678$
The smallest possible number we can make is $136{,}678$.
